486B17D445C14CD99A0C039FFD931971.description: Actively engage in individual or group readings of informational text with purpose and understanding.

861E62E5340C43C6BC0F94DDC9B44D22.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text

37493FE1CCA44637B750D07E2E2E87A8.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

A34B10FE872D459DA5A30AFEE729EA7F.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

BC522F9B7BA24A859002E78C4AA157C9.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

721A92603900428193B635A313378430.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

CD65A8A673E443DDA96DFB8957FAEADE.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

124F8EC9EE004080AC8D5C44A3A5663B.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

498632DFF2FE4FE992403E36206162F9.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb duck).

5F1639691A864866A4B3AD846D42F1A5.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on Kindergarten reading and content.

19970B082AD144BE9F1D7E63D275A0D1.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

BB19922AE4B646248CAFEA57F1AF6F87.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

897283569D0E439A8FF133C11D20AA78.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

0C3CDC22272C4B9DA14CE59D14CFFD89.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

71226E693E75485DA1D125E1FACA8369.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

F14DF39C4A334872883EEFE3E87C8CCE.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

6DF70402C60B4FF78D469AA61F075FE2.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

63733A5A7B0C421F80585C7B35D7809D.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

D34CE474001F4553ADB843C44859F9BC.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

A00BFCED1B16436CB61B25ACC2E9B6E0.description: Listen to high quality prose and poetry of appropriate complexity for Kindergarten.

E918B93E46494CB4930707B22DC787AE.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text

7010468E296946B6A0459968DF70C06B.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

52E72C8252D146479765F22E1040DE20.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

942456DAEA4D499A8C2D073B4CDAC68E.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

4DE86AD7C5B94F48B3BC175126599304.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

4CC384AF61B543C78E1AD988EDDFEFD5.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

3F9014A91D4046ADB92C7277B03FBF68.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

FB4B17E0D8804C49853448AEDFA6D5C2.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb duck).

86C9E44D6E2C459C98375A97C69C4A25.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on Kindergarten reading and content.

6340ED83A85740D7B5A51BE51227D4B8.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

A6A36F937DCB40EAAE213581A69F93FF.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

53D851262A3C4ACD909FC6F84259A48C.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

C8A3700595734948A421129E8976246F.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

8C1927BEEDF14FE4896E43E3FF8BF74F.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

8D5D2E2D3B4C4C91A6EC0DDB6A328CCD.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

A596470ABD1E43E2986D56840D7ED72B.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

43FE3E39C6164A33A8F032077192E070.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

37C16B3A12AB4EB3AFFB2D60274AC7B1.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

B0A8E772340F4E8CBC872B69AA474D0F.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ (e.g., bat/cat, bat/bit/, bat/bad).

C4D39457CB3A43C19A1958E6A046C4B4.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

40010938511E474182CA320C67809225.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

09DBD10594694A939E612F5C2F32439A.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

3BCA3F35B664406E94A31248F0D62C13.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

DCDDEDA59DF24416BB01A421034DD24B.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

1BD808D239314697A23FB863F6047FA9.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVC ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

8B1C9D9159EE4BFB9D9E440D91FDBFDC.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

C6FF8C38E81242509FF68153714D85E5.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

76079604165747BEA48F14756CE7B199.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

A220A76107B04435AA8EA3A4DF42F528.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

9C50CC97AEDE4179B5E438A036C6C1F7.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print and can point with one-to-one correspondence.

8CC400592BC243F9843A26384214CC98.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

09F9BA3F81DA49BCB0ABAD8F13773C9C.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

305C77EFB6794A5898B8963C54BCE5DD.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

0AE5418656DB4ECCA5ABFCE30BEB4B4D.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading, and through being read to.

671C160B1BC24D6F83C97133BCE1FA0A.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

B70B0CB89EF54D62967315B2B5D109FF.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions in written work (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

D632141D082F4EBD8C27C56A9FD7EF48.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

A6A6BF6C2CA14271885781A6A8C30F22.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

12B025A4B74A424190393E219D35D8F5.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs in speech.

E41B2119A02D4E48A20B0E9758B7469C.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standards English grammar and usage when speaking.

B8A13D70171F4C6DB5EF42EE5C5459C7.description: Speak with appropriate volume, enunciation, and rate, or order to express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

6423BB710436478793DF13CB234F75F3.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

1E1164A09916499CA6BEE3C45021B797.description: Use details to describe familiar people, places, things, or events with prompting and support.

4C101463DB8A4AC9A2A3E95875F2FB04.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

1C156828CCAA42DA981B1C89121A1DC5.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

99A51A3EE1C3473D8D8D82E5990024C0.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

69ABB29980A4458B8F613223F7A9FBEA.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

568371AD003744A0A6D8581AA610F9B3.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about Kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

0969D5F8C32744ABAF62308534316CD4.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of letter-sound relationships.

63808D981D7647C0BC588A494F721A52.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short vowel sounds.

7D537703351247A88454A63CC8EFD411.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

07ADCC4FE7524B09B37EBE7834463D67.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

299A4CFF79D7472BA031FD14C4FD05E4.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

69CB76C34D5443C7A2B6FAE311B1D103.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions in written work (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

1DD7FB04E94A4F70AB6B0E629218B9EF.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

C7230A89D4F5423186501A85BEF961DA.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs in writing.

9463A29B4CFE44D7A2065F9D91D7CCF3.description: Print many upper and lowercase letters.

C08E73FA04A34C338A0B82F77309132C.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standards English grammar and usage when writing.

0139C725FD9D48719208E2E65EAA725E.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

A907EB2B12B24CD2A9CC771EC484EA33.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

42DA35606C4F4E78B24F6EE74E042ACE.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

BDF5E8D9D7784AABB05231BAA9AF6A1D.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

501C661C6938473EB0D9B2B20C57823A.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

1AA356090AF04213898C7F1F95859A53.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

149A089D583A42AC90AAF90D6E68C09F.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

744EE75AA0994CB19DCC186716524738.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is . . .).
